page.title: 04Morwesntow Community Centre
page.content: Parishioners first thought of building a hall during the 1939-45 War. After a referendum some 40 years on, the Morw- enstow Community Centre Management Committee, representing local organis- ations and the public started the pro- ject in 1982. Grant aid was obtained to combine with local gift and effort. The Government scheme for using the many unemployed on Community Projects helped. The hall, completed in 1985, was designed, as far as funds allowed, to suit all local needs, eg. concerts, indoor sports and meetings. A doctor's surgery was included. On May 11th 1985 Craig Rich, BBC South West "Weatherman" declared it open. Children were dressed as weathermaps, storms, frost, rainbows, etc. The community then sat down to tea and in the evening there was a celebration dance.
